column2: Put the words in the right order.
column3: My father, {{c1::who}} {{c1::was}} {{c1::a}} {{c1::teacher}} (teacher / who / a / was), is now retired.

column2: Put the words in the right order.
column3: My car, {{c1::which}} {{c1::I've}} {{c1::had}} {{c1::for}} {{c1::ten years}} (I've / for / which / ten years / had), has never broken down.

column2: Put the words in the right order.
column3: I went to see the doctor, {{c1::who}} {{c1::advised}} {{c1::me}} {{c1::to}} {{c1::change}} {{c1::my diet}} (me / my diet / advised / to / who / change).

column2: Put the words in the right order.
column3: The new stadium, {{c1::which}} {{c1::will be}} {{c1::finished}} {{c1::next}} {{c1::month}} (finished / which / month / will be / next), will hold 90,000 spectators.

column2: Put the words in the right order.
column3: We often go to visit our friends in Cambridge, {{c1::which}} {{c1::is}} {{c1::not}} {{c1::far}} {{c1::from}} {{c1::London}} (London / far / is / which / not / from).

column2: Put the words in the right order.
column3: Joe, {{c1::who}} {{c1::was}} {{c1::in}} {{c1::a}} {{c1::bad mood}} (a / was / bad mood / in / who), didn't enjoy the party.

column2: Put the words in the right order.
column3: I had a good view of the city from my hotel room, {{c1::which}} {{c1::was}} {{c1::on}} {{c1::the}} {{c1::twentieth}} {{c1::floor}} (was / floor / the / which / on / twentieth).

column2: Put the words in the right order.
column3: Peter and Emily have a daughter, Amy, {{c1::who}} {{c1::has}} {{c1::just}} {{c1::started}} {{c1::school}} (started / just / who / school / has).

column2: Put the words in the right order.
column3: The sun, {{c1::which}} {{c1::is}} {{c1::one of}} {{c1::millions of stars}} {{c1::in the universe}} (is / in the universe / millions of stars / which / one of), provides us with heat and light.
